hints_html:
The cumulative distribution function, \(F(x)\), can be obtained by integrating the probability density function from negative infinity to \(x\). i.e:

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}f(t)\,dt\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
The cumulative distribution function, <math>F(x)</math>, can be obtained by integrating the probability density function from negative infinity to <math>x</math>. i.e:
:<math>
F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}f(t)\,dt
</math>
question: 1 (m)
sols_html:
The cumulative distribution function, \(F(x)\), can be obtained by integrating the probability density function from negative infinity to \(x\). i.e:

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}f(t)\,dt\end{aligned}\]

(Note that we can assume that \(f(x) = 0\) if \(x > 2\) or \(x < 1\)). Applying the defintion of the cumulative distribution to this problem gives:

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) = \begin{cases} \int_{-\infty}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ \int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{x}2(t - 1)\,dt&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\ \int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{2}2(t - 1)\,dt + \int_{2}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x > 2\\ \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

Simplifying gives:

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) = \begin{cases} 0 &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ x^2 - 2x + 1&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\ 1 &\mbox{if } x > 2\\ \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The cumulative distribution function, <math>F(x)</math>, can be obtained by integrating the probability density function from negative infinity to <math>x</math>. i.e:
:<math>
F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}f(t)\,dt
</math>
(Note that we can assume that <math>f(x) = 0</math> if <math>x > 2</math> or <math>x < 1</math>). Applying the defintion of the cumulative distribution to this problem gives:
:<math>
F(x) = \begin{cases} \int_{-\infty}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ 
\int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{x}2(t - 1)\,dt&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\
\int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{2}2(t - 1)\,dt + \int_{2}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x > 2\\
\end{cases}
</math>

Simplifying gives:
:<math>
F(x) = \begin{cases} 0 &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ 
x^2 - 2x + 1&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\
1 &\mbox{if } x > 2\\
\end{cases}
</math>
statement_html:
Compute the cumulative distribution function corresponding to the density function

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f(x) = 2(x-1), \quad 1 \leq x \leq 2.\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
Compute the cumulative distribution function corresponding to the density function

: <math> \displaystyle f(x) = 2(x-1), \quad 1 \leq x \leq 2.</math>
